results.title: Joy
results.creator_credit: Rachel Clements, AFTRS and Cate Shortland
results.brief_description:
Thursday night. Late night shopping. Joy wants to have fun. This film follows a teenage girl as she hits the town in search of a good time. But Joy’s search for fulfilment leaves her lost and lonely at the end of the evening as we follow her to her unhappy home. By the director of Somersault (2004) Original format 35 mm/colour
WARNING: This film contains scenes that may offend some viewers

results.title: Journeys into the unknown : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Eight members of the community tell their stories of living with HIV. With a fierce zest for life and adventure, they tell of how their lives have changed but also of how they have fought back against the disease and look forward to the journey ahead.
results.title_for_label: Journeys into the unknown : Digital Storytelling project

results.title: Journeys in space and time
results.creator_credit: Gregory Andorfer, Adrian Malone, Polytel International, BBC, Carl Sagan Productions and KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Cosmos: a personal voyage”.
In this episode Carl Sagan explores the relationship of space and time. He begins by showing how the shape of the constellations would change over millions of years, as the stars move and evolve, and then launches into a discussion on the speed of light and Einstein’s theory of relativity, concluding with the tantalising possibilities of time travel and parallel universes.

results.title: Journey: the quest for self-reliance
results.creator_credit: CBS, B F A Educational Media and Nina Kleinberg
results.brief_description: Ron Hood, a young ‘outdoors’ person, takes us on a typical wilderness trip which has helped him become more confident in his own abilities. Starting out on one side of the Sierra Nevada Mountains in California with a few tools and the clothes on his back, he covers 70 miles, making or finding all his needs, while reaching the other side of the range. Filmed in Sequoia National Forest. Narrated by Lloyd Steele.

results.title: Journey to the Pacific
results.creator_credit: Dimension Films, United States Information Agency and Gary Goldsmith
results.brief_description: An extensive record of the journey of President Johnson to various countries in the Pacific area including New Zealand, the Philippines, Thailand, Korea, Malaysia, South Vietnam and Australia. Official functions as well as informal moments on land and in the air. Edited by George Lucas (of Star Wars fame).

results.title: Journey to the interior with Dick Smith
results.creator_credit: Tony Salmon and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Dick Smith is often regarded as an unofficial ambassador for Australia and his knowledge and love of this vast country makes for an informative, and yet visually stunning, documentary. His journey begins at Sydney Harbour in a helicopter and Dick Smith’s intention is to fly from Sydney to the remote desert settlement of Birdsville, a trip over 1,000 miles in length. The film contains historical and descriptive commentary by Dick Smith, interviews, and some magnificent aerial photography of the Australian landscape, including Sydney, the Blue Mountains, the Darling River, Burke, kangaroos bounding across the desert, and various landmarks along the way to Birdsville.

results.title: Journey to the end of night
results.brief_description: Bill Neave, a World War II veteran, recounts his wartime experiences direct to the camera. The memories of these events are so vivid that he is still able to re-enact them and he does this on film, discussing such events with his long-dead friends. From an idea suggested and researched by Ruben Mow.

results.title: Journey to the centre of a triangle (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Katharine Cornwell, Bruce Cornwell and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Examines the incentre, circumcentre, the centroid, and the orthocentre of triangles. Visual constructions illustrate each kind of centre, and several examples are used to show how each is determined. Without narration. For beginning geometry students.

results.title: Journey to Antarctica
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall, Maslyn Williams, Lee Robinson and Philip Law
results.brief_description: Records a trip to Antarctica with a typical Australian National Antarctic Research Expedition. Phillip Law tells of the work done by the 70 men who man the four Australian stations. Shows the erection of an automatic weather station; reconnaisance; the daily routine of the scientists at the stations; and follows a surveying exploratory party using tractor trains and supported by aircraft.
